src:
;
; WDIDN 3 (1982)
; Zork: The Cavern of Doom
; by Steve Meretsky
;
; Each node is a page in the book, with
; the lines between them representing 
; choices. The first page is drawn in
; black and marked with a dot.
;
; Pages that contain an ending are color- 
; coded based on the goodness of that 
; ending. red is catastrophic, warm colors 
; are of varying levels of mediocrity, and 
; blue is the ideal, ‘winning’ ending.
;

; don’t color in the decision pages
{color:none}

; choices
2 -> 7
7 -> 13
7 -> 15
7 -> 19
7 -> 21
13 -> 21
15 -> 21
19 -> 21
21 -> 26
21 -> 31
26 -> 33
26 -> 36
33 -> 38
33 -> 41
36 -> 33
36 -> 43
38 -> 41
38 -> 45
41 -> 48
41 -> 50
48 -> 53
48 -> 57
50 -> 53
50 -> 57
53 -> 56
53 -> 57
57 -> 60
57 -> 62
62 -> 66
62 -> 68
62 -> 71
66 -> 74
66 -> 68
66 -> 71
74 -> 77
74 -> 80
77 -> 82
77 -> 84
77 -> 88
84 -> 91
84 -> 94
94 -> 96
94 -> 100
96 -> 102
96 -> 104
104 -> 113
104 -> 115
104 -> 117
104 -> 119

; endings
2 {color:#444, shape:dot, label:·}
31 {color:#b01700}
43 {color:#b01700}
45 {color:#b01700}
56 {color:#c6531e}
60 {color:#c6531e}
68 {color:#c6531e}
68 {color:#c6531e}
71 {color:#c6531e}
71 {color:#c6531e}
80 {color:#db8e3c}
82 {color:#db8e3c}
88 {color:#db8e3c}
91 {color:#b01700}
100 {color:#db8e3c}
102 {color:#ffe35f}
113 {color:#ffe35f}
115 {color:#ffe35f}
117 {color:#ffe35f}
119 {color:#95cde5}
title: The Cavern of Doom
